citation.article-title: Rickettsia honei sp. nov., the aetiological agent of Flinders Island spotted fever in Australia

p.s: Description of Rickettsia honei sp. nov.
Rickettsia honei (ho.ne.i. L. gen. n. honei of Hone, named after Frank Sandland Hone, an Australian physician who was an early pioneer in Australian rickettsiology (8, 12-14)
This agent is an obligately intracellular bacterium which can be grown at 32Â°C in Vero cells with RPMI 1640 supplemented with 10 % foetal calf serum and 2 mM L-glutamine (11).
Its morphology is characteristically rickettsial in nature as determined by electron microscopy (1).
SDS-PAGE, immunoblotting and species-specific monoclonal antibody analyses demonstrated the uniqueness of R. honei (27).
We have further characterized this agent by sequence analysis and have shown that R. honei is truly a new member of the SFG.
The type strain of R. honei is strain RBT, isolated from a person with the clinical manifestations of Flinders Island spotted fever.
This strain has been deposited in the American Type Culture Collection as ATCC VR- 1472T.
